title: Alexei Navalny - Wikipedia
snippet: On 20 January, registration of the party was suspended; according to Russian laws, no two parties can share a name. On 8 February 2014, Navalny's party changed its name to "Progress Party". title: Russia of the Future - Wikipedia
snippet: Russia of the Future (Russian: ... (Партия Прогресса, Partiya Progressa), is a banned opposition political party in Russia founded on 15 December 2012 by Leonid Volkov and later refounded on 19 May 2018 by Alexei Navalny, who was also the founder of the non-profit ...

title: Aleksey Navalny | Facts, Biography, Poisoning, Death, & Imprisonment | Britannica
snippet: In the November 2016 legislative election, United Russia claimed victory, but election observers again documented numerous irregularities, including instances of ballot stuffing and repeat voting. Navalny’s Progress Party was barred from contesting the election after the Russian justice ministry canceled its registration.

title: Kremlin Foe Navalny Launches New Political Party
snippet: She said that the goals of the party included "real changes, real reforms," including increased property protections, a fair criminal-justice system, and battling corruption "so that money from the budget does not flow into offshores and is not spent on yachts and palaces." Navalny who has organized large street protests and published numerous reports documenting alleged corruption by Russia's ruling elite, was barred from running in the March presidential election due to a conviction on financial-crimes charges he contends were fabricated.

title: Russia of the Future
snippet: Russia of the Future (Russian: Россия Будущего) is an unregistered opposition political party in Russia, founded by Alexei Navalny on May 19, 2018, as a rebranding of the Progress Party to advance anti-corruption efforts and liberal ...
